title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: A heartwarming and heartbreaking story of friendship, creativity, and love across decades, set in the world of video game development.

title: Fourth Wing
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: A thrilling fantasy romance set in a dragon-riding military school where survival is everything.

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus
description: A witty and empowering tale of a 1960s woman scientist who becomes an unexpected TV cooking star.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
description: A charming tale about a caseworker who finds love and purpose at an orphanage for magical children.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save Earth with the help of an unexpected alien companion.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A woman explores alternate lives she could have lived through a magical library at the edge of death.

title: Babel
author: R.F. Kuang
description: A linguistic and colonial critique disguised as a dark, magical academic thriller in 1800s Oxford.

title: Remarkably Bright Creatures
author: Shelby Van Pelt
description: A widow bonds with a giant Pacific octopus in a touching tale of healing and connection.

title: Yellowface
author: R.F. Kuang
description: A sharp critique of cultural appropriation and the publishing industry, told through a morally ambiguous narrator.

title: Book Lovers
author: Emily Henry
description: Two rivals in publishing fall in love in this clever, bookish romantic comedy.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A reclusive Hollywood icon reveals her scandalous life story to a young journalist.

title: The Paris Library
author: Janet Skeslien Charles
description: Based on a true story, a tale of bravery and friendship in the American Library in Paris during WWII.

title: Before the Coffee Gets Cold
author: Toshikazu Kawaguchi
description: In a small Tokyo café, visitors can travel back in time—but only for the duration of one cup of coffee.

title: The Anthropocene Reviewed
author: John Green
description: Essays reviewing facets of the human-centered world, filled with humor and sincerity.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A chilling romantic thriller where nothing is as it seems and the truth is buried in a manuscript.

title: I'm Glad My Mom Died
author: Jennette McCurdy
description: An unflinching, raw, and often funny look at childhood fame and a toxic relationship with her mother.

title: The Love Hypothesis
author: Ali Hazelwood
description: A fake-dating setup between a STEM PhD student and a grumpy professor evolves into real love.

title: Demon Copperhead
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: A modern-day retelling of David Copperfield, set in Appalachia and exploring addiction and resilience.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
description: A mortal girl is swept into a fae world of magic, love, and danger in this seductive fantasy saga.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: Two best friends go on one last vacation in a second-chance romantic comedy.
